title: 59-year-old killed in hit-and-run incident in Kohuwala
byline: A pedestrian was killed in a hit-and-run accident on the Saranankara Road in Kohuwala, last night (10), police stated.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall above 50 mm likely in some areas today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in the Galle, Matara, Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts today (11), the Department of Meteorology.

title: Second reading of National Audit (Amendment) Bill in Parliament today
byline: The second reading of the National Audit (Amendment) Bill is scheduled to be taken up in Parliament today.

title: Charlie Kirk: Donald Trump ally shot dead at campus event in Utah
byline: US right-wing activist and commentator Charlie Kirk, an influential ally of President Donald Trump, was fatally shot in the neck on Wednesday at an event at a Utah university in what the governor described as a political assassination.

title: SriLankan Airlines resumes flights to Nepal
byline: SriLankan Airlines has resumed flights to Nepal following the reopening of the Tribhuvan International Airport in Katmandu.

title: Fire at Sapugaskanda Oil Refinery contained
byline: The fire that broke out at the Sapugaskanda Oil Refinery yesterday (10) has now been fully brought under control.

title: Former Presidents lose official residences under new law – Mahinda set to return to Carlton House
byline: Under the provisions of the newly enacted “Presidents’ Entitlements (Repeal) Act,” former presidents are now required to return the official residences previously allocated to them.

title: Oracle co-founder Larry Ellison briefly tops Elon Musk as world’s richest person
byline: Elon Musk briefly lost his title as the world’s richest person to Larry Ellison, the co-founder of Oracle and an ally of US President Donald Trump.

title: Nepal Protests: No consensus yet on interim leader; death toll rises to 30
byline: Disagreement has emerged among “Gen Z” campaigners over who should lead an interim administration, as Nepal faces a political crisis following the fall of the K.P. Sharma Oli government, triggered by a youth-led protest against corruption.

title: Parliament adjourned for 10 minutes
byline: Parliament has been adjourned for 10 minutes following a heated situation in the chamber this morning (11).

title: Toyota to manufacture EV SUVs at US Kentucky plant
byline: Toyota Motor will start making two battery-powered sport utility vehicles at its U.S. Kentucky plant, as part of a move to improve manufacturing efficiency and better serve market demand, the Japanese automaker said.

title: Police arrest two suspects linked to separate shooting incidents
byline: Two suspects connected to separate shooting incidents have been arrested, police stated.

title: 109 Sri Lankans currently in Nepal are safe, Foreign Ministry confirms
byline: A total of 109 Sri Lankans currently in Nepal are accounted for and safe, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs has confirmed.

title: Bali floods kill 14, search continues for two missing
byline: The death toll from this week’s floods on the Indonesian island of Bali has risen to 14 people from nine, a government official said on Thursday (Sep 11), though the rain has stopped and water levels are receding in most areas.

title: Maru, the record-breaking cat with a love of boxes, has died
byline: Maru the cat, known for his love of sitting in cardboard boxes, has died.

title: 106 judicial officers, including magistrates and district judges transferred
byline: A total of 106 judicial officers, including magistrates and district judges have been transferred.

title: Politicians and diplomats visit ex-President Mahinda Rajapaksa at his Wijerama residence
byline: A group of politicians and diplomats have visited the official residence of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa on Wijerama Road in Colombo this morning.

title: India’s IT sector nervous as US proposes outsourcing tax
byline: India’s massive IT sector faces a lengthy period of uncertainty with customers delaying or re-negotiating contracts while the U.S. debates a proposed 25 per cent tax on American firms using foreign outsourcing services, analysts and lawyers said.

title: Appeals Court issues notices in case seeking national land management policy
byline: The Court of Appeal has issued notices to several parties, including the Minister of Lands and the Minister of Environment, instructing them to submit their responses on November 28 in relation to a petition calling for the formulation of a National Land Management Policy in Sri Lanka.

title: Tusker ‘Mahasilu’ found dead in Okkampitiya
byline: The carcass of an elephant named Mahasilu, which had been seen roaming in Buttala and Okkampitiya, has been discovered this morning (11) in a paddy field in Ilukpitiya, Okkampitiya.

title: Ex-President Mahinda vacates residence at Wijerama Road
byline: Former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has vacated his official residence located at Wijerama Road in Colombo.

title: ‘Podi Manike’ derails between Haliela and Badulla stations
byline: Train services along the Upcountry Railway Line have been disrupted owing to the derailment of the ‘Podi Manike’ train (1006) which was traveling from the Badulla Railway Station to Kandy and Colombo Fort at around 8.50 a.m.

title: Prince Harry meets King Charles for first time in more than a year
byline: Prince Harry has met his father King Charles at Clarence House in London, their first face to face meeting since February 2024.

title: Netherlands approves grant of EUR 730,000 for rural bridges project in Sri Lanka
byline: The Netherlands has approved a grant of EUR 730,000 to support the ongoing Design and Construction of Rural Bridges Project in Sri Lanka, the Ministry of Finance, Planning and Economic Development said in a statement.

title: Chaos at Delhi Airport: Over 200 passengers deplaned from Air India’s Singapore-bound plane
byline: Over 200 passengers on Air India flight AI2380 to Singapore have been forced to deplane at the Delhi airport after enduring nearly two hours inside an aircraft with malfunctioning air conditioning and electrical systems on Wednesday night.

title: Police SI arrested on suspicion of maintaining close ties with ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’
byline: A Sub-Inspector of Police has been arrested on suspicion of maintaining close ties with ‘Kehelbaddara Padme’, a known member of an organized criminal gang.

title: Ex-Director General of UDA Sumedha Ratnayake arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: Former Director General of the Urban Development Authority (UDA) Sumedha Ratnayake and former Director - Lands of the UDA arrested by the Bribery Commission.

title: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga withdraws appeal
byline: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga’s attorneys have withdrawn an appeal filed on behalf of him with the Court of Appeal seeking an order to acquit him of the suspended prison sentence and fines imposed on him.

title: President meets new board members of Ceylon Chamber of Commerce
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has met with the newly appointed Board of the Ceylon Chamber of Commerce today (11) at the Presidential Secretariat in Colombo.

title: Delhi High Court rules against unauthorised use of Aishwarya Rai’s name, photos
byline: Delhi High Court has barred the misuse of Aishwarya Rai Bachchan’s name, photographs etc. through online platforms or via artificial intelligence.

title: Sri Lanka’s GDP growth for 2025 expected at 3.1% - FinMin officials
byline: Sri Lanka’s GDP growth for 2025 is projected to be around 3.1%, according to officials attached to the Ministry of the Finance.

title: Former Director General and Director of UDA granted bail
byline: Former Director General of the Urban Development Authority (UDA) Sampath Sumedha Ratnayake and former Director (Lands) of the UDA Weerawansa Perera, who were arrested on corruption charges, have been released on bail Colombo Magistrate’s Court.

title: 15 Sri Lankan underworld figures in custody in foreign countries: Minister
byline: Sri Lanka’s Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala says that a total of fifteen Sri Lankan underworld figures with Interpol ‘Red Notice’ issued against them are currently in the custody of authorities in foreign countries, including Russia, Oman, India and Dubai in UAE.

title: “Our task is not to shield children from technology, but to guide them” - PM
byline: Prime Minister and Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, officially launched STEM Feed in Sri Lanka, a new in-app destination on TikTok offering credible science, technology, engineering and mathematics content.

title: French lawmakers urge social media ban for under-15s
byline: Children under 15 in France should be banned entirely from using social media, and those aged between 15 and 18 should face a nighttime “digital curfew”, a French parliamentary committee urged on Thursday (Sep 11).

title: Army Lt. Colonel arrested for selling ammunition to underworld figure
byline: The Commanding Officer of the army camp in Palinagar, a Lieutenant Colonel, has been arrested by the Western Province North Police Crime Division.

title: 2026 Budget Speech on November 7
byline: The Secretary General of Parliament, Kushani Rohanadeera, stated that the second reading of the Appropriation Bill (also known as the Budget Speech) for the year 2026 will be held on 7 November, 2025, followed by the budget debate from 8 November to 5 December, 2025.

title: President meets top USTR officials, discuss potential US-SL trade deals
byline: United States Ambassador to Sri Lanka, Julie Chung, together with a delegation of senior officials from the Office of the United States Trade Representative (USTR), met with President Anura Kumara Dissanayake at the Presidential Secretariat today (11) for discussions.
